title: Heavy floods in DR Congo’s Kinshasa leave dozens dead, destroy homes
snippets: The capital struggles as the Ndjili River overflows, leaving drivers stranded, and infrastructure collapses.
summary: The Ndjili River's overflow has caused significant disruptions in the capital, resulting in stranded drivers and the collapse of infrastructure. This situation highlights the challenges faced by the city due to the river's overflow.
titles: Heavy floods in DR Congo’s Kinshasa leave dozens dead, destroy homes

title: Over 50 countries seek US trade talks after tariffs: Trump officials
snippets: The tariffs have been widely criticised around the world for threatening to push the global economy into a recession.
summary: Tariffs introduced have faced global criticism for potentially propelling the world economy towards a recession. This reflects widespread concerns over the negative impacts these financial measures could have on international economic stability.
titles: Over 50 countries seek US trade talks after tariffs: Trump officials

title: Defiant Trump officials vow to stay course as countries scramble over tariffs
snippets: The US commerce secretary says a 10% "baseline" tariff on imports will definitely stay in place for weeks.
summary: The US Commerce Secretary announced that a 10% baseline tariff on imports will remain in effect for several weeks. This decision ensures that the tariffs, which impact the cost of imported goods, will not change in the immediate future.
titles: Defiant Trump officials vow to stay course as countries scramble over tariffs

title: Will anyone face justice for the Rafah ambulance convoy attack?
snippets: Recovered mobile phone video shows official Israeli account is false.
summary: A mobile phone video recovered recently disproves the official Israeli account of an incident, showing that the previously stated facts by Israeli authorities do not align with the events recorded on the video. This development challenges the accuracy of the official narrative provided by Israel.
titles: Will anyone face justice for the Rafah ambulance convoy attack?

title: Rising rivers threaten US South and Midwest after severe weather kills 18
snippets: Forecasters warn that flooding could continue for days, as torrential rains keep falling in many US states.
summary: Forecasters have issued warnings that several US states are facing the risk of continued flooding due to ongoing torrential rains. This weather event is expected to persist for several days, affecting various regions with significant water levels.
titles: Rising rivers threaten US South and Midwest after severe weather kills 18

title: Liverpool to begin negotiations to sign “massively underrated” star in a club-record deal
snippets: Liverpool could lose Mohamed Salah when his contract expires at the end of the season, and they have already identified a potential target to replace him.Real Madrid attacker Rodrygo Goes has been ide...
summary: Liverpool is at risk of losing Mohamed Salah as his contract is set to expire at the season's end. The club has identified Real Madrid attacker Rodrygo Goes as a potential replacement.
titles: Liverpool to begin negotiations to sign “massively underrated” star in a club-record deal

title: Islanders spoil Alex Ovechkin's record-breaking day with 4-1 win over Capitals
snippets: Alex Ovechkin scored his record-breaking 895th career goal, but the New York Islanders beat the Washington Capitals 4-1 on Sunday.
summary: Alex Ovechkin set a new record by scoring his 895th career goal, making him the highest-scoring player in history. Despite this achievement, the Washington Capitals were defeated by the New York Islanders with a final score of 4-1 in the game that took place on Sunday.
titles: Islanders spoil Alex Ovechkin's record-breaking day with 4-1 win over Capitals

titles: Best men's Final Four ... ever?! Breaking down Houston's, Florida's epic comebacks

title: Big investors look to sell out of private equity after market rout
snippets: Pensions and endowments seek exit from battered portfolios in blow to buyout industry
summary: Pensions and endowments are looking to sell their investments in buyout funds due to poor performance, impacting the private equity sector. This shift marks a significant challenge for the buyout industry as it relies on such institutional investors for capital.
titles: Big investors look to sell out of private equity after market rout

title: Le Pen rages against political ‘witch-hunt’ at Paris rally
snippets: Far right leader addresses supporters at demonstration after conviction that could ban her from standing for president
summary: A far-right leader spoke to her supporters during a rally following her conviction, which may prevent her from running for president. The outcome of the legal process has raised concerns about her political future and eligibility to stand in presidential elections.
titles: Le Pen rages against political ‘witch-hunt’ at Paris rally

title: Trump officials vow to stay the course on tariffs despite market turmoil
snippets: Treasury secretary rejects recession fears and says tough ‘reciprocal’ levies will not be delayed
summary: The Treasury Secretary has dismissed concerns about a potential recession, stating that the implementation of stringent 'reciprocal' tariffs will proceed without delay. This decision reflects a commitment to maintaining the planned economic measures despite fears of negative impacts on the economy.
titles: Trump officials vow to stay the course on tariffs despite market turmoil

title: US closes in on critical minerals deal with DR Congo
snippets: Trump’s Africa adviser agrees ‘path forward’ to drive American mining investment as Tshisekedi government seeks to shore up support
summary: The Trump administration's Africa adviser has reached an agreement on a 'path forward' to enhance American investment in mining, in collaboration with the Tshisekedi government. This move aims to bolster support for the mining sector in the region.
titles: US closes in on critical minerals deal with DR Congo

title: JD Vance has the zeal of the convert — and that’s a problem
snippets: The vice-president thinks nothing of lecturing America’s friends and allies
summary: The vice-president has been reported to frequently lecture America's friends and allies on various matters. This behavior suggests a direct approach in diplomatic interactions, focusing on conveying messages or concerns. The current status or outcomes of these interactions have not been specified.
titles: JD Vance has the zeal of the convert — and that’s a problem
